intro: Malapoenna sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
